name: 1-benzyloxy-3-iodobenzene
Reason: 1-benzyloxy-3-iodobenzene has a melting point that can be predicted by considering the basic unit of benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5°C. The introduction of a benzyl group (c1ccc(cc1)CO) adds rigidity and molecular weight, increasing the melting point by approximately +30°C. The iodine atom (I) can participate in hydrogen bonding, which may raise the melting point by approximately +10°C. The presence of a benzyl group introduces a rigid structure and increases the molecular weight, which can contribute to a higher melting point. The iodine atom can also participate in hydrogen bonding, which may raise the melting point by approximately +10°C.
